Job Description:
Exciting Opportunity: Join LEGO® Manufacturing Vietnam as a Quality Technician (IPQC) and become part of a team that thrives on innovation, excellence, and creating the beloved LEGO bricks that inspire imaginative play in children around the globe. Apply now and build a career that shapes the future of creativity!

Work Location: Our factory is based in VSIP 3, Binh Co Ward, Ho Chi Minh (formerly called Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen - Binh Duong). Shuttle buses are provided from Ho Chi Minh, Bien Hoa & Binh Duong

Please copy and paste the following URL into your browser for your application: https://www.lego.com/en-us/careers/job/quality-technician-packing-2d67dffb63fe1001ae491a434b920000

Core Responsibilities

• Perform in process audit, inspection and record according to quality plan (Classify of defects/issues, follow AQL sampling plan, and issue nonconformity (NCMS) report)
• Kiểm tra chất lượng trên chuyền theo kế hoạch (Phân loại lỗi/vấn đề, tuân thủ kế hoạch lấy mẫu AQL và đưa ra báo cáo về các lỗi NC)
• Participate to containment and corrective actions of NC materials, FG and follow up the problem solving till done, including the handling of quarantined FG and WIP.
• Tham gia vào các hành động ngăn chặn và khắc phục vật liệu hoặc hàng thành phẩm bị lỗi NC, và theo dõi việc giải quyết vấn đề cho đến khi hoàn tất, bao gồm cả việc xử lý nhóm hàng thành phẩm và WIP đang bị cách ly.
• Investigate root cause of quality issues, communicate to relevant Depts, and follow up the problem solving
• Điều tra nguyên nhân gốc rễ của các vấn đề về chất lượng, trao đổi với các Phòng ban liên quan và theo dõi việc giải quyết vấn đề
• Apply the basic statistical methods for data analysis and PDCA/Quality tools in problem solving
• Áp dụng các phương pháp thống kê cơ bản để phân tích dữ liệu và các công cụ Chất lượng hoặc PDCA trong việc giải quyết vấn đề
• Shiftly report for quality performance per department and QMS requirements
• Báo cáo theo ca về hiệu suất chất lượng theo yêu cầu của hệ thống quản lý chất lượng QMS
• Report any quality risks or abnormality to supervisor
• Báo cáo bất kỳ rủi ro hoặc bất thường về chất lượng nào cho người quản lý trực tiếp
• EHS and 5S audit in the assigned areas
• Thực hiện kiểm tra về An Toàn & 5S tại khu vực được giao
• Lead or participate to Quality Circle (Small Group Activities) and Track/ verify / validate improvement actions’ effectiveness in own areas
• Dẫn dắt hoặc tham gia Vòng tròn chất lượng (Hoạt động nhóm nhỏ) và theo dõi/xác minh/xác thực hiệu quả của các hành động cải tiến trong các lĩnh vực được giao
• Conform to and participate in internal/external audit (IMS, CCC, FSC, ...), LEGO Continuous Improvement (LCI) assessment and annual TIP setting
• Tuân thủ và tham gia các hoạt động kiểm toán nội bộ/bên ngoài (IMS, CCC, FSC, ...), đánh giá về các hoạt động cải tiến liên tục (LCI) và thiết lập kế hoạch bộ phận hàng năm.
• Stop production in case of identified serious EHS or Quality risk. Escalate and actively collaborate to immediately resolve the situation.
• Dừng sản xuất trong trường hợp phát hiện rủi ro nghiêm trọng về An toàn hoặc Chất lượng. Tăng cường và tích cực hợp tác để giải quyết ngay tình hình.
• Support relevant projects in plant.
• Hỗ trợ các dự án có liên quan trong nhà máy.
• Other tasks assigned from superior
• Hoàn thành các nhiệm vụ khác được giao từ cấp trên.

Play your part in our team succeeding

• Do line audit for Quality and EHS standards
• Kiểm tra dây chuyền theo tiêu chuẩn chất lượng & an toàn
• Leverage CI in shopfloor
• Ứng dụng cải tiến liên tục tại khu vực sản xuất
• Maintain conformance to regulation/internal rules and IMS standards
• Duy trì tuân thủ theo quy định/quy tắc nội bộ và tiêu chuẩn IMS
• Support production lines to solving quality problems, organization of immediate remediation on the lines, identification of the root cause of non-conforming production, line audits, archiving of documents.
• Hỗ trợ dây chuyền sản xuất giải quyết các vấn đề về chất lượng, tổ chức khắc phục ngay lập tức trên dây chuyền, xác định nguyên nhân gốc rễ, kiểm tra dây chuyền, lưu trữ tài liệu.
• Support incident investigation.
• Hỗ trợ điều tra sự cố .
ZERO vision – Our ambition and commitment to create and ensure safe and healthy work and to prevent all accidents, harm and work-related diseases to achieve excellence in health, safety and wellbeing.
Dare to Care – Everyone is committing to keep themselves healthy and safe by showing concern and awareness for the health and safety.
Only the best is good enough – The high focus on Quality goes back to the family DNA and the historic legacy of the LEGO Group.

Title: Senior CAD Engineer - Remote
Company: Page Group Vietnam
Location: Ho Chi Minh, Ho Chi Minh
Job Description:
As a CAD engineer, you'll lead the technical execution of mid‑to‑large concrete formwork and elevated slab shoring projects-owning design calculations, erection/assembly drawings, and jobsite technical support.


Description

Engineering & Design

Produce engineered formwork/shoring layouts, erection plans, and clear, easy‑to‑read technical drawings aligned to project requirements
Perform structural checks/calculations (loads, concrete pressures, shores/props capacity, bracing, climbing systems) to ensure safety and constructability.

Project Execution

Coordinate across Sales, Manufacturing, and Distribution to align design intent with production schedules and delivery logistics. 
Support pre‑assembly planning and method statements; adjust designs based on site conditions, RFIs, and customer feedback.

Field & Customer Support

Provide on‑site technical guidance during staging, assembly, cycling, stripping, and safety checks-partnering with Field Service for hands‑on training.


Profile

* Education: Bachelor's degree in Civil/Structural/Construction Engineering or related field
 * Experience: 10 years in formwork/shoring, structural temporary works, or concrete construction; experience producing erection/assembly drawings and calculations.
 * Technical Skills: Proficiency with structural analysis and drafting (AutoCAD/Inventor or similar) and formwork load/pressure design. 
 * Ability to interpret specs, plans, and apply system capabilities to practical site solutions. 
 * Soft Skills: Strong communication, customer service mindset, cross‑functional collaboration, and field readiness for jobsite support. 
 * Willingness to travel to jobsites;


Job Offer

* Salary package including 13th month salary and performance bonus
 * Allowances
 * Medical insurance
 * Career growth across engineering, drafting, manufacturing, and field service
 * Access to the Concrete Construction & Forming Institute for hands‑on training.

Title: Technical Manager
Company: Mondelēz Kinh Đô Việt Nam
Location: Hung Yen Plant, Hung Yen Province, 8th Floor, Empress Tower, 138-142 Hai Ba Trung Street, Sai Gon Ward, HCMC
Job Description:
PURPOSE OF ROLE:
• The Technical Manager is responsible for managing all technical and engineering
activities of the FMCG manufacturing plant, ensuring equipment reliability, production
efficiency, food safety, quality compliance, cost optimization, and continuous
improvement.
• This person is responsible for establishing a vision, strategies, and tactical application of
predictive maintenance and service management techniques for plant facility and
equipment and for championing, mentoring, and training maintenance and service
management resources within the plant.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Equipment & Maintenance Management
• Lead preventive, predictive, and corrective maintenance for all production lines, utilities,
and facilities.
• Ensure high equipment availability and minimize downtime.
• Develop and monitor KPIs: GE, MTBF, MTTR, M&R cost, Downtime....
• Manage spare parts strategy and critical equipment list.
2. Engineering & Projects
• Coordinate with BDE to support installation, commissioning, and qualification of new
machines and production lines.
• Coordinate with suppliers, contractors, and OEMs.
• Support layout optimization and capacity expansion.
3. Production & Quality Support
• Collaborate with Production and Quality teams to ensure stable processes.
• Support root cause analysis for technical issues impacting quality, safety, or output.
• Ensure compliance with HSE, GMP, HACCP, ISO, FSSC, or relevant standards.
• Ensure equipment design and operation meet food safety requirements.
4. Utilities & Infrastructure
• Manage utilities systems: boiler, compressor, HVAC, water treatment, wastewater,
electricity, Building…
• Optimize CO2, energy, water, and utility consumption.
• Ensure compliance with environmental, safety, and legal regulations.
5. Continuous Improvement & IL6S
• Drive PM Pillar to inline with IL6S journey.
• Lead loss analysis and technical improvement projects.
• Promote standardization, documentation, and best practices.
• Apply digital tools for maintenance and data analysis where applicable.
6. People Management
• Lead, coach, and develop engineers, technicians, and maintenance teams.
• Define competency development plans and technical training.
• Manage shift structure, workload, and performance evaluation.
• Build a safety-first and ownership culture.
7. Safety & Compliance
• Ensure all technical activities comply with HSE standards.
• Lead risk assessments, LOTO, machine guarding, and safety audits.
• Investigate technical-related incidents and implement corrective actions.
8. Key Interfaces
• Internal: Production, Quality, PPIC, LOG, Facility, HSE, Finance, HR
• External: Equipment suppliers, contractors, auditors, service providers
9. Other tasks are required when needed.

Title: Call Center Manager
Company: Tala
Location: Unit 617-618, Level 6 and 7, Friendship Tower, 31 Le Duan, Saigon Ward, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Unit 617-618, Level 6 and 7, Friendship Tower, 31 Le Duan, Saigon Ward, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
About the Role

The Call Center Operations Manager is responsible for overseeing the end-to-end CX and payment support operations, including frontline teams, QA, Training, Workforce Management, and Dialer Administration.

This leader ensures operational excellence, strong repayment performance, high-quality customer interactions, and full compliance across all touchpoints. The role requires a balance of team management, hands-on operational execution, and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Risk, Compliance, Data, and external partners.

What You'll Do

CX & Payment support Operations Leadership
-Lead the Customer Service Advocates and payment support teams to meet performance and service targets.
-Oversee day-to-day operations across all channels (chat, email, voice, in-app, social…).
-Manage escalations, case resolution, and end-to-end customer and borrower experience.
-Drive operational KPIs: FRT, Resolution Time, CSAT, RPC, PTP, Recovery, Connect Rate and ensure team to achieve monthly targets.

Quality Assurance (QA) Management
-Do the QA evaluation for the team and ensure timely coaching and corrective action plans, lead the QA team (if any) responsible for evaluating CS and payment support interactions.
-Maintain and update QA rubrics, scorecards, and calibration among teams.
-Monitor quality trends and collaborate with TLs/trainers to address skill or compliance gaps.

Training & Knowledge Management
-Oversee new hire onboarding, nesting, and continuous learning programs.
-Deliver effective training on product, systems, scripts, soft skills, compliance.
-Maintain and update SOPs, knowledge bases, macros, LCM content, and process documentation.
-Track training effectiveness and improve materials based on QA findings and performance gaps.

Dialer Administration & Contact Strategy Oversight
-Manage dialer activities where needed.
-Ensure optimal setup and management of outbound dialing campaigns (predictive, power, manual).
-Monitor real-time dialing performance (connect rates, RPC, agent occupancy).
-Ensure compliance with call time windows, frequency limits, consent, and opt-out rules.
-Collaborate with telco partners to ensure stable outbound capacity.

Workforce Management (WFM) & Capacity Planning
-Arrange schedules for both CS and payment support.
-Monitor attendance, productivity, and capacity gaps.
-Adjust workforce plans based on volume spikes, outages, or campaign changes, recruit agents when needed.
-Optimize agent allocation across queues, channels, and DPD buckets.

Reporting, Analytics & Performance Tracking
-Review daily/weekly dashboards and operational reports (FRT, AHT, RPC, PTP, QA, Recovery, ticket volume).
-Provide insights and recommendations to leadership on performance trends and issues.
-Partner with data/reporting teams to ensure accuracy, consistency, and visibility of KPIs.
-Conduct root-cause analyses for service or performance failures.

Compliance & Governance
-Ensure all customer and payment support interactions comply with legal and regulatory requirements.
-Enforce call/SMS frequency limits, approved scripts, tone guidelines, and bank/regulator expectations.

DMS trade promotion management:

• Coordinate with DMS project team to ensure high data accuracy, productivity, and visibility of sales performance.

• Theo dõi tiến độ sản xuất sản phẩm mới để đảm bảo ra mắt đúng timeline.

• Kiểm tra trưng bày & danh mục tại cửa hàng/kênh online, đảm bảo đúng assortment theo guideline.
• Báo cáo hiệu quả kinnh doanh danh mục theo tuần/tháng/quý.
3. Production & Supply Coordination (15%): Điều phối sản xuất & cung ứng

• Benchmark sản phẩm đối thủ: giá, chất liệu, thiết kế, thông điệp, packaging.

Title: Secondary Administrative Officer
Company: British International School Hanoi
Location: BRITISH INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL, HANOI, Lot H3-H4, Hoa Lan Road, Vinhomes Riverside Long Bien, Hanoi
Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE
You’ll help us to provide support to Head of Secondary and support operation of Secondary Team and Secondary Office.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
As Secondary Administrative Officer, you are expected to:

1. Manage Secondary Office reception duties:
- Handle all emails coming in and from the Secondary School Office email and all phone calls into the Secondary School extension.
- Assist students with administrative queries.
- Direct visitors, parents, and students to the right person.
- Inform parents via telephone or emails regarding events happening in Secondary School.
- Prevent miscommunication between parents and school.
2. General administrative tasks:
- Support SSLT and the teaching team with parent communications via telephone, email, iSAMS and Bloomz.
- To have detailed knowledge and strict adherence to safeguarding and child protection procedures; take immediate actions where necessary.
- Track and follow-up on student attendance to prevent truancy.
- Distribute letters/ group emails to parents and students.
- Maintain the supplies of standard forms in the office.
- Assist in preparing student reports when required.
- Be part of the holiday rota for office staff.
- Assist other office staff members when required.
3. Provide support for the Faculty Leaders, Heads of Year and other Secondary staff:
- Provide translation and interpreting support.
- Send individual and group letters to parents regarding routine matters such as set changes, Trip Meetings, Parents Evenings or individual parent meetings.
- Provide administrative support for routine and ad hoc purchasing.
- Manage Secondary School’s events and booking system.
- Assist with administrative tasks.
4. Responsibilities related to co-curricular activities with monthly responsibility allowance:
- Work with Marketing team to edit activities brochures, ensuring the content matches with SchoolBuddy.
- Handle SchoolBuddy software: updating data, guiding parents/students in using of software, extracting data. Follow up application of students via SchoolBuddy, deal with questions from students and parents.
- Organise paid activities: contact teachers/suppliers; ensure all teachers are qualified professionally and legally; insert activity content on SchoolBuddy; follow up payment of students; contract, and timesheet procedures for teachers.
- Collect documents and follow up to ensure all CCAs third party staff have valid police check and safeguarding certificate as per school policies.
- PO/Claim procedures for relating fees of CCAs.
- Liaise with bus coordinator to ensure the bus arrangement for students during CCAs
- Daily follow up attendance of students in CCAs, update student’s attendant on SchoolBuddy.
- Arrange cover for teachers absent from CCAs.
- Displaying and updating data of CCAs on notice boards and to teachers.
- Prepare finance report for paid club by term end.
5. Perform other duties assigned by Line manager/ Business Director/ Principal.

The closing date for application is 19 January 2026 although we reserve the right to interview and make an appointment before the advertised closing date for the role. Therefore, an early application is recommended.
